alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; McCormick (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 12 at 5:00PM EST until January 12 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central McDuffie County in east central Georgia... Northwestern Columbia County in east central Georgia... Southeastern Lincoln County in east central Georgia... Northwestern Edgefield County in central South Carolina... Southeastern McCormick County in central South Carolina... * Until 545 PM EST. * At 459 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Mistletoe State Park, or 12 miles northeast of Thomson, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Clarks Hill Recreation Area and J. Strom Thurmond Dam around 515 PM EST. Hamilton Branch State Park around 520 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Parksville, Winfield, Modoc, Scott`s Landing, Knox Scout Reservation, Double Branches, Wildwood Park, Cleora, Modoc Boat Ramp and Colliers. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: This Tornado Warning replaces the Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued for the same area. TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately. This Tornado Warning includes portions of Lake Strom Thurmond. Boaters, move to shore and take shelter on the lowest floor of the closest sturdy building!
